template.template: Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2
template.name: Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2
template.description: Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2(3.5) or later

discovery_rule.name: CPU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: If your IOS device has several CPUs, you must use CISCO-PROCESS-MIB and its object cpmCPUTotal5minRev from the table called cpmCPUTotalTable , indexed with cpmCPUTotalIndex . This table allows CISCO-PROCESS-MIB to keep CPU statistics for different physical entities in the router, like different CPU chips, group of CPUs, or CPUs in different modules/cards. In case of a single CPU, cpmCPUTotalTable has only one entry.

item_prototype.name: Загрузка процессора
item_prototype.description: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html The cpmCPUTotal5minRev MIB object provides a more accurate view of the performance of the router over time than the MIB objects cpmCPUTotal1minRev and cpmCPUTotal5secRev . These MIB objects are not accurate because they look at CPU at one minute and five second intervals, respectively. These MIBs enable you to monitor the trends and plan the capacity of your network. The recommended baseline rising threshold for cpmCPUTotal5minRev is 90 percent. Depending on the platform, some routers that run at 90 percent, for example, 2500s, can exhibit performance degradation versus a high-end router, for example, the 7500 series, which can operate fine.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:cpmCPUTotal5minRev[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(300)}>{$CPU_LOAD_MAX}
trigger_prototype.name: Загрузка ЦПУ слишком велика

discovery_rule.name: Memory Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoMemoryPoolTable, a table of memory pool monitoring entries. http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

item_prototype.name: Used memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on themanaged device.

item_prototype.name: Free memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device.Note that the sum of ciscoMemoryPoolUsed andciscoMemoryPoolFree is the total amount of memoryin the pool

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:memoryUsedPercentage[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(300)}>90
trigger_prototype.name: Мало свободной памяти ОЗУ

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoEnvMonTemperatureStatusTable (ciscoEnvMonTemperatureStatusDescr), a table of ambient temperature status maintained by the environmental monitor.

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] Температура
item_prototype.description: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB The current measurement of the testpoint being instrumented.

item_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}]Temperature status
item_prototype.description: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB The current state of the testpoint being instrumented.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:ciscoEnvMonTemperatureStatusValue[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(300)}>{$TEMP_WARN:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}
trigger_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}] Температура выше нормы: >{$TEMP_WARN:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}

dependency.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}]Температура очень высокая: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}
dependency.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:ciscoEnvMonTemperatureStatusValue[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(300)}>{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2_3.5_ or later SNMPv2:ciscoEnvMonTemperatureStatusValue[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(300)}>{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}
trigger_prototype.name: [{#SNMPVALUE}]Температура очень высокая: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}

template.template: Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2
template.name: Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2
template.description: Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0(3)T and prior to 12.2(3.5)

discovery_rule.name: CPU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: If your IOS device has several CPUs, you must use CISCO-PROCESS-MIB and its object cpmCPUTotal5minRev from the table called cpmCPUTotalTable , indexed with cpmCPUTotalIndex . This table allows CISCO-PROCESS-MIB to keep CPU statistics for different physical entities in the router, like different CPU chips, group of CPUs, or CPUs in different modules/cards. In case of a single CPU, cpmCPUTotalTable has only one entry.

discovery_rule.name: Memory Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoMemoryPoolTable, a table of memory pool monitoring entries. http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

item_prototype.name: Загрузка процессора
item_prototype.description: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html The overall CPU busy percentage in the last 5 minute period. This object deprecates the avgBusy5 object from the OLD-CISCO-SYSTEM-MIB. This object is deprecated by cpmCPUTotal5minRev which has the changed range of value (0..100)

item_prototype.name: Used memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on themanaged device.

item_prototype.name: Free memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device.Note that the sum of ciscoMemoryPoolUsed andciscoMemoryPoolFree is the total amount of memoryin the pool

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2:cpmCPUTotal5min[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(300)}>{$CPU_LOAD_MAX}
trigger_prototype.name: Загрузка ЦПУ слишком велика

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0_3_T and prior to 12.2_3.5_ SNMPv2:memoryUsedPercentage[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(300)}>90
trigger_prototype.name: Мало свободной памяти ОЗУ

template.template: Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2
template.name: Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2
template.description: Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0(3)T

item.name: Загрузка процессора
item.description: OLD-CISCO-CPU-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html 5 minute exponentially-decayed moving average of the CPU busy percentage.

discovery_rule.name: Memory Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoMemoryPoolTable, a table of memory pool monitoring entries. http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

item_prototype.name: Used memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on themanaged device.

item_prototype.name: Free memory
item_prototype.description: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device.Note that the sum of ciscoMemoryPoolUsed andciscoMemoryPoolFree is the total amount of memoryin the pool

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2:memoryUsedPercentage[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(300)}>90
trigger_prototype.name: Мало свободной памяти ОЗУ

trigger.expression: {Template Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2:avgBusy5.avg(300)}>{$CPU_LOAD_MAX}
trigger.name: Загрузка ЦПУ слишком велика
